pages.text: Pipes, once you can make them, is a great way to transport power, liquid, and items around.$(p)Start by SHIFT-RIGHT CLICKING against two blocks you want to link, and connecting them with Pipes between them. Then, you can RIGHT-CLICK the connectors to configure them.

pages.name: Pipe Demo
pages.text: $(7)$(o)This is a simple demonstration of a basic Pipe Network.
The $(2)Basic Pipes$() are very simple. Their GUIs only have:$(li)An $(9)input$() button.$(li)An $(c)output$() button.$(br)Both can be toggled, so a block can input AND output materials.
The $(2)Advanced Pipes$() gain:$(li)Transfer controls.$(li)Filter slots.$(li)$(l:items/upgrades)3 Upgrade slots.$(/l)
The $(2)Ultimate Pipes$() are the most advanced Pipes available. They do not gain features from Advanced Pipes, but the speed is greatly increased.

pages.title: Omnipipes
pages.text: Finally, there are the $(2)Omnipipes.$()$(p)These unique pipes are special in that they transport items, energy, and liquids all within the same pipe.$(p)All pipes have three configurable I/O buttons for each channel.
